title: SEBI proposes measures to expand resident Indian participation in FPIs
summary: SEBI proposes to increase resident Indian participation in Foreign Portfolio Investments by enabling retail schemes in IFSCs to register as FPIs and aligning contribution limits. Indian mutual funds may also become constituents of FPIs, allowing investment in overseas funds...
fullContent: SEBI proposes to increase resident Indian participation in Foreign Portfolio Investments by enabling retail schemes in IFSCs to register as FPIs and aligning contribution limits. Indian mutual funds may also become constituents of FPIs, allowing investment in overseas funds with Indian securities exposure. Public feedback is invited by August 29, 2025, potentially reshaping FPI operations in India.

title: How digital real estate is making property investment accessible to Indians
summary: Digital real estate platforms are transforming property investment in India, traditionally hampered by high costs and complex processes. These platforms offer fractional ownership and tokenization, lowering entry barriers from lakhs to thousands of rupees.
fullContent: Digital real estate platforms are transforming property investment in India, traditionally hampered by high costs and complex processes. These platforms offer fractional ownership and tokenization, lowering entry barriers from lakhs to thousands of rupees. This shift caters to younger, tech-savvy investors and high-net-worth individuals seeking risk-managed assets.

title: What should fixed income investors do post RBI Monetary Policy Meeting
summary: Reserve Bank of India maintains repo rate at 5.50% in August 2025. This decision follows earlier rate cuts and CRR reduction. Experts suggest focusing on high-rated bonds with 2-4 year duration. A possible rate cut may occur in October 2025.
fullContent: Reserve Bank of India maintains repo rate at 5.50% in August 2025. This decision follows earlier rate cuts and CRR reduction. Experts suggest focusing on high-rated bonds with 2-4 year duration. A possible rate cut may occur in October 2025. Investors should consider moderate-duration fixed income strategies. Global economic factors and Federal Reserve policies will influence future decisions.

title: FII selling crosses Rs 50,000 crore in IT stocks in 2025. Is tech dead money or just misunderstood?
summary: FIIs have heavily sold Indian IT stocks in 2025, causing a significant downturn and making it the worst-performing sector. Disappointing earnings and layoffs have fueled the sell-off, impacting major companies like TCS.
fullContent: FIIs have heavily sold Indian IT stocks in 2025, causing a significant downturn and making it the worst-performing sector. Disappointing earnings and layoffs have fueled the sell-off, impacting major companies like TCS. While valuations are now more attractive, analysts are cautiously optimistic, suggesting a potential tactical bounce but emphasizing the need for a new technology cycle for a sustained recovery.

title: Think. Over the week
summary: In our Editorial section, the Monetary Policy Committee’s meeting was the major topic of analysis. The pause on policy rates, which was anticipated by one and all, was welcomed in our Editorial. It was argued that in the context of the Trump tariff turmoil, a status quo on...
fullContent: In our Editorial section, the Monetary Policy Committee’s meeting was the major topic of analysis. The pause on policy rates, which was anticipated by one and all, was welcomed in our Editorial. It was argued that in the context of the Trump tariff turmoil, a status quo on rates was inevitable .The first quarter results of Corporate India was dissected in another Editorial. It was argued that in the backdrop of Trump tariff hikes and a gloomy external scenario, India Inc was set to face a bumpy road going ahead. How the DoT’s Telecom Identifier User Entities through a government-run Mobile Number Validation (MNV) platform – which proposes to authenticate users by matching mobile numbers against telecom databases – will lead to serious privacy issues, was another major topic analysed in our Editorial section.

title: Trump’s tariff shocker: How India’s commodities and currency reacted
summary: U.S. tariffs on Indian imports, effective August 1, 2025, have sent shockwaves through India's markets. Gold prices soared to record highs, while crude oil and natural gas prices declined amid demand concerns.
fullContent: U.S. tariffs on Indian imports, effective August 1, 2025, have sent shockwaves through India's markets. Gold prices soared to record highs, while crude oil and natural gas prices declined amid demand concerns. Base metals experienced volatility, and the rupee weakened against the dollar. India is focusing on trade negotiations and diversification to mitigate the impact, avoiding retaliatory tariffs.

fullContent: India's banking sector is witnessing a shift as public sector banks regain market share after a decade, even with moderating credit expansion. While overall loan growth has slowed due to tighter liquidity and regulatory measures, PSBs are outperforming private banks, driven by stronger financials.

title: Mind Over Money: From F1 Tracks to Tennis Courts — How Sports Shape Ashish Singhal’s Entrepreneurial Mindset
summary: Ashish Singhal, the Co-founder of CoinSwitch and Lemonn, draws parallels between high-intensity sports like Formula 1 and tennis, and the startup world. He emphasizes the importance of precision, preparation, and mental resilience in both arenas.
fullContent: Ashish Singhal, the Co-founder of CoinSwitch and Lemonn, draws parallels between high-intensity sports like Formula 1 and tennis, and the startup world. Singhal highlights how split-second decisions, team coordination, and the ability to recover from setbacks are crucial for success in crypto and finance.

title: How hedge funds performed in turbulent July
summary: Hedge fund performance in July was a mixed bag, with stockpickers benefiting from rising markets while systematic funds initially struggled due to crowded trades. Goldman Sachs reported stockpickers gained almost 1.
fullContent: Hedge fund performance in July was a mixed bag, with stockpickers benefiting from rising markets while systematic funds initially struggled due to crowded trades. Goldman Sachs reported stockpickers gained almost 1.5%, while systematic funds saw a negative 2% return before recovering. Multi-strategy funds posted muted results, and individual fund performances varied widely.

title: Pepper…and Salt
US gold futures pare gains after official says White House to clarify tariff policy on bullion bars
summary: Gold prices experienced volatility. This happened after the White House announced plans for an executive order on gold tariffs. The U.S. Customs and Border Protection also indicated potential tariffs on gold bullion bars. The spread between U.S.
fullContent: Gold prices experienced volatility. This happened after the White House announced plans for an executive order on gold tariffs. The U.S. Customs and Border Protection also indicated potential tariffs on gold bullion bars. The spread between U.S. gold futures and spot prices widened. Some refineries paused bullion deliveries to the United States due to uncertainty.
